LEAD: Leading National Advertisers, an independent media advertising monitor, has issued a report on publishing companies that made the best advertising gains (in both percentage and dollar terms) from their magazines in the first six months of this year.

Leading National Advertisers, an independent media advertising monitor, has issued a report on publishing companies that made the best advertising gains (in both percentage and dollar terms) from their magazines in the first six months of this year.
The best percentage gain was made by the Gannett Company, with 34.7, followed by Straight Arrow Publishers, U.S. News/The Atlantic, Murdoch Magazines and Family Media.
The best dollar gainer was Time Inc., with about $69.5 million, followed by Conde Nast Publications, The New York Times Company Magazine Group, Times Mirror Magazines and the Meredith Corporation.
